\doxysubsection{Detailed Description}
\subsubsection*{template$<$typename T = none$>$\newline
class sockpp\+::result$<$ T $>$}
A result type that can contain a value of any type on successful completion of an operation, or a std\+::error\+\_\+code on failure. 

Objects can contain a value of type T on an operation\textquotesingle{}s success, or a standard {\ttfamily error\+\_\+code} on failure. As an implementation detail, the class isn\textquotesingle{}t implemented with a union or variant, but rather both types are available. When the error code indicates "{}success"{} (where it has an internal value of zero), then the result value is considered valid. If the code contains an error, that takes precedence and the result value is set to the default for that type -\/ zero for an int, empty for a string, etc.

The result can act as a boolean -\/ {\itshape true} for a successful result, {\itshape false} for an error/failure.

The result can also be directly compared to values of type T or to any of the standard error types, {\ttfamily std\+::error\+\_\+code}, {\ttfamily std\+::error\+\_\+condition}, or {\ttfamily std\+::errc}. When comparing to type T, it will always fail if the result is an error, otherwise it will do a comparison of the T values. Comparing to an error will simply compare the error values.

As a weird corner case, comparing an error code of zero -\/ which indicates "{}no error"{} -\/ against a result will always be true for {\itshape any} successful result value. This should probably not be done as it could lead to some confusion.

template$<$typename T  = none$>$ \\
const \mbox{\hyperlink{error_8h_ab1e0c0347ae112be97a91664fd6c830d}{error\+\_\+code}} \& \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1result}{sockpp\+::result}}$<$ T $>$\+::error (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption}) const\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



Gets the error code from a failed operation. 

This is only valid if the operation failed. If not, it returns the default error code which should have a value of zero (success). \begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A const reference to the error code. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

Determines if the result represents a successful operation. 

If true, then the success (value) variant of the result is valid. \begin{DoxySeeAlso}{See also}
\doxylink{classsockpp_1_1result_af8e4fa8ee1afdb71a9bce85384696003}{is\+\_\+ok()} 
\end{DoxySeeAlso}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
{\itshape true} if the result is from a successful operation, {\itshape false} if the operation failed. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\Hypertarget{classsockpp_1_1result_a06e4fc6ac992c1745f3a3a3edfbbe2fe}\index{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$@{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$}!release@{release}}
\index{release@{release}!sockpp::result$<$ T $>$@{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{release()}{release()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1result_a06e4fc6ac992c1745f3a3a3edfbbe2fe} 
template$<$typename T  = none$>$ \\
T \&\& \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1result}{sockpp\+::result}}$<$ T $>$\+::release (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



Releases the value from this result. 

The value is only valid if the operation was successful. Releasing the value will move it out of this result, leaving an unknown, but valid value in its place. This might be necessary to retrieve a value that only implements move semantics (such as a socket), or if the caller would rather not copy the object.

The result should not be used after releasing the value.

\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
The success value. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
\Hypertarget{classsockpp_1_1result_a1ea8441c908ab0fd47c826dd6fa6e707}\index{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$@{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$}!release\_or\_throw@{release\_or\_throw}}
\index{release\_or\_throw@{release\_or\_throw}!sockpp::result$<$ T $>$@{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{release\_or\_throw()}{release\_or\_throw()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1result_a1ea8441c908ab0fd47c826dd6fa6e707} 
template$<$typename T  = none$>$ \\
T \&\& \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1result}{sockpp\+::result}}$<$ T $>$\+::release\+\_\+or\+\_\+throw (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



Releases the value if the result is a success, otherwise throws a system error exception corresponding to the internal error code if it hold an error. 

The result should not be used after releasing the value.

\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A const reference to the success value. 
\end{DoxyReturn}

\begin{DoxyExceptions}{Exceptions}
{\em std\+::system\+\_\+error} & if the result is an error \\
\hline
\end{DoxyExceptions}
\Hypertarget{classsockpp_1_1result_a95c7fa89b3d6f513bde329686d546b94}\index{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$@{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$}!value@{value}}
\index{value@{value}!sockpp::result$<$ T $>$@{sockpp::result$<$ T $>$}}
\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{value()}{value()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{classsockpp_1_1result_a95c7fa89b3d6f513bde329686d546b94} 
template$<$typename T  = none$>$ \\
const T \& \mbox{\hyperlink{classsockpp_1_1result}{sockpp\+::result}}$<$ T $>$\+::value (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption}) const\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}}



Gets the value from a successful operation. 

This is only valid if the operation was a success. If not, it returns the default value for type T. \begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
A const reference to the success value. 
\end{DoxyReturn}
